ANN ARBOR, MICH.
E. G. BURROWS, PROGRAM DIRECTOR
11 Nov. 1957
Mr. Harold Hill
NAEB
Urbana, Ill.
Dear Harold:
Just had a letter from Jim Miles anent
the plans for feature articles in the News¬
letter.
I learn he has volunteered my help on
this. Such faith ought not go unrewarded.
May I suggest a series of ”Confidential,t-
type exposes on the members? Or possibly a
serial blasting the conventional classroom
instruction in our schools and colleges, and
making the point that all future teaching
be done exclusively by radio-TV? I am sure
other such thrilling ideas will occur to me
in the near future, and I am delighted to
have the chance to air them through the
Newsletter....
Please let me know the space requirements
and deadlines, etc. 1*11 be happy to help
if I can-either on the above topics, or
whatever less-exciting ones you care to
suggest.
Cordially.,
William Bender, Jr.
cc: Jim Miles
PS: Sorry to have missed the convention; I
hear it went very well.
